title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki - XWiki
content:
lucaa joined #xwiki at 00:05  
Menso - (00:39): hehe  
Menso - (00:39): Basically I'm using Event.observe to watch my form and I want to figure out which form element has gotten the focus  
Menso - (00:40): but I can't figure out how to do it, if I use Event.observe("form", "click", etc then it works with clicks, but not if someone tabs from one field to the next and changing "click" into "focus" doesn't work either

Menso - (14:27): I'm using a bit of code to loop through form elements on a page and assign them an autosuggest widget, but they all get assigned the same widget despite the code… Can there be more than one autosuggest on a pagE?  
jvelo - (15:08): Menso, there can definitely be more than one suggest on a page. Which version of XWiki are you using btw ?  
Menso - (15:21): My current dev environment is running 2.5.32127  
Menso - (15:21): I pasted the code here: http://pastebin.com/CMYSHhHu  
Menso - (15:22): Basically this loops through a form and assigns the autosuggest to specific elements based on their name, but they all seem to get assigned the same suggest instead of one of the two options

vmandrilly joined #xwiki at 16:19  
vmandrilly - (16:20): Hello!  
mflorea - (16:21): vmassol: I have one test failing in xwiki-rendering-tests with the latest sources, can you reproduce?  
mflorea - (16:21): Failed tests:  
mflorea - (16:21):   simple/encoding/encoding1.test [xhtml/1.0, xhtml/1.0](org.xwiki.rendering.scaffolding.RenderingTestCase)  
vmandrilly - (16:31): Here is where I am with tmy project : 1- xwiki installed and running on the computer. 2- xwiki now online. 3- I did a short description of the project. Next step should have been to detail the different things to do, then describe how everything should work, with pictures, but I have been too curious and started to learn velocity. The information on the apache website is very small, but now I can do a set to give a variable a value, make additions, use   
lucaa joined #xwiki at 16:31  
vmandrilly - (16:34): And don't ask me if I am a begginner, the anwear is yes :P

vmandrilly - (17:07): hello, my room is full of lucca enter and leaves the room, how can I stop these messages?  
cjdelisle` - (17:43): vmandrilly, not sure, have to look at documentation for your irc client.  
cjdelisle` - (17:44): something about not displaying quit/join messages I assume.  
cjdelisle` - (17:44): I just ignore all the quit/join spam. It's usually caused by bad internet connections.  
jvelo - (17:46): mflorea, I reproduce the rendering test failure  
mflorea - (17:47): jvelo: thanks  
Denis left at 18:07 (Quit: Leaving.  
vmandrilly - (18:32): cjdelisle: thanks. I did learn the velocity as you recommanded. How to get input from the user, read from and write to database ? Any doc somewhere ?  
cjdelisle` - (18:33): If you have a <form> <input name="inputName" /> and you submit that form, what was typed into the input field will be available to velocity as $request.getParameter("inputName")  
vmandrilly - (18:34): ok  
vmandrilly - (18:36): Any doc for all these xwiki commands like $request.getParameter ? So that I can find the infos about database and others  
vmandrilly - (18:36): ?  
cjdelisle` - (18:37): http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/DevGuide/Scripting start here, follow the links.  
vmandrilly - (18:37): thanks  
vmandrilly - (18:38): Should I learn Java first ?  
vmandrilly - (19:02): ok I think I should better go for pithon or ruby since it is availlable and seem more simple.  
vmassol left at 19:13 (Quit: Leaving.  
Enygma` left at 20:20 (Ping timeout: 240 seconds  
Menso - (20:29): Can I update or add stuff to xwiki.org documentation?  
jvelo - (20:33): Menso, yes you can  
jvelo - (20:33): it's a wiki :)  
Menso - (20:39): That's what I figured, but I can't find a register link :-) http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/login/XWiki/XWikiLogin?xredirect=http%3A%2F%2Fplatform.xwiki.org%2Fxwiki%2Fbin%2Fview%2FMain%2F  
jvelo - (21:28): Menso, you might be interested by autoSuggest behavioral CSS classes  
jvelo - (21:29): check http://svn.xwiki.org/svnroot/xwiki/platform/web/trunk/standard/src/main/webapp/resources/js/xwiki/xwiki.js and search for "Suggest"  
jvelo - (21:30): if you implement it for your use case, it would mean you would just have to add a "suggestSupplier" or "suggestProduct" CSS class to your input, and it would suggest the proper type of item  
jvelo - (21:36): BTW there is a problem with your example : you seem to use the same ID for several form elements. This is not correct, you should rather use class names (ID are supposed to be unique in the DOM)  
vmandrilly left #xwiki at 21:38  
mflorea left at 21:40 (Quit: Leaving.  
Menso - (22:03): jvelo: the thing is I'd like to modify the code base itself as little as possible, so rewriting xwiki.js files I'd rather avoid  
jvelo - (22:04): Menso, that's not what I meant. You don't have to modify xwiki.js, just look at the example I've pointed out to write your own code  
Menso - (22:04): I adjusted the sample code a little, what it does for me is loop through form elements and if they end in \_Supplier or \_SoftProd they get assigned their appropriate autosuggest  
Menso - (22:05): I'm not sure I see what you mean in the url you provided  
jvelo - (22:05): let me make you a snippet  
jvelo - (22:13): Menso, check http://tinypaste.com/17547  
jvelo - (22:13): (not tested though :)  
jvelo - (22:14): If you have some time to make it work and update the page on xwiki.org, that would be great! (this one is cleaner and closer to our dev. practices)  
Menso - (22:15): how do I add classes to my class properties?  
jvelo - (22:16): ah you use XClasses and doc.display ?  
Menso - (22:16): yus  
jvelo - (22:16): there is no easy yet I think  
jvelo - (22:16): one sec  
Menso - (22:16): That's why I did it the way I did  
jvelo - (22:18): but how can it work with ID your example ?  
jvelo - (22:18): myForm[i].id =='Supplier'  
jvelo - (22:18): you can't have such an id generated by doc.display  
jvelo - (22:18): there is something you could do though  
Menso - (22:18): right, so my code actually does this  
jvelo - (22:18): supplier and product are properties, right ?  
Menso - (22:19): if(Right(myForm[i].id, 8)=='Supplier'){  
jvelo - (22:19): I see  
Menso - (22:19): and the element is called blahclassbs\_Supplier  
jvelo - (22:19): you can do different  
sdumitriu joined #xwiki at 22:20  
jvelo - (22:21): coming back with a new snippet  
jvelo - (22:21): :)  
jvelo - (22:23): Menso, http://tinypaste.com/819ee9  
jvelo - (22:24): again, not tested. Maybe you don't need the quotes around 'name', I don't recall  
jvelo - (22:27): Menso, actually there is a mistake, it's ~= not =~  
jvelo - (22:28): but even better, it should use $=  
jvelo - (22:28): "input[name$='\_Supplier']"  
Menso - (22:28): does .endswith actually exist?  
jvelo - (22:28): it's a prototype method, yes  
jvelo - (22:29): prototype.js I mean  
Menso - (22:29): hah, excellent, I should use that then :-)  
jvelo - (22:29): for  "input[name$=\_Supplier]" check http://www.prototypejs.org/api/utility/dollar-dollar  
lucaa joined #xwiki at 22:33  
jvelo - (22:34): sdumitriu, Hi. Is it normal clirr complains when adding a method to an interface ?  
sdumitriu - (22:34): Yes  
jvelo - (22:34): What should I do ? disable it ?  
jvelo - (22:35): ot  
jvelo - (22:35): it's for XWIKI-5789  
sdumitriu - (22:35): Yes, disable clirr on that class  
jvelo - (22:35): ah did not know we could disable on a per class basis  
sdumitriu - (22:35): It's normal since all implementations of that interface must be updated  
sdumitriu - (22:35): Classes that used to work well before now won't compile  
jvelo - (22:36): I see
